item.description: BO - Design - Image Settings - CRUD Steps Step Description Expected result Go to Design > Image Settings the image settings page is well displayed Click on “Add new image type " a new page is displayed with title " Add new” fill the blanks with the informations >Save a green alert display “Successful creation” the image settings list +1 Click on button “edit " the image settings page of the latest image type created is well displayed with title “Edit: test_type” change the informations of image setting created succesful message is displayed “Successful update”

item.title: BO - Design - Image Settings - Delete actions
item.description: BO - Design - Image Settings - Delete actions Steps Step Description Expected result * Do the Precondition “BO - Image Settings - Create an Image type random” twice * Scroll down and click on “Regenerate thumbnails” * Clic on “Regenerate” on the modal * You’ll have two new image type * You’ll have a new modal * You’ll have products on the new format in [nameofyourshop]/img/p if you setup your image type for product * Clic on the down arrow next to the first Image type create * An other button should be dropped down * Clic on the “Delete” button * A new modal named “Are your sure you want to delete this image seeting?

item.title: BO - Design - Image Settings - Import Image type - feature not integrated -
item.description: BO - Design - Image Settings - Import Image type - feature not integrated - Steps Step Description Expected result Clic on the “Generate theme image settings” button at the top right A modal should be displayed Case : You don’t have yml file for your theme with image type * Clic on the “import” button * You’ll have a red alert with the message " Your themes doesn’t have image types configured" * You still have 0 image type Case : You have yml file for your theme with image type * Clic on the “import” button * You’ll have a success message “The settings have been successfully updated” * You’ll have your image type Case : You have the same yml file for your theme with image type * Clic on the “import” button * You’ll have a red alert with the message " Your themes doesn’t have image types configured" * You still have the same image type Case : You have the same name on your image type but not the same size on your yml * Clic on the “import” button * You’ll have a red alert with the message " Your themes doesn’t have image types configured" * You still have the same image type Case : You have the same size on your image type but not the same name on your yml * Clic on the “import” button * You’ll have a success message “The settings have been successfully updated” * You’ll have twice your image type

item.title: BO - Design - Image Settings - Image Generation options - QA Analyst version
item.description: BO - Design - Image Settings - Image Generation options - QA Analyst version Steps Step Description Expected result Case : Your server support Avif * Go to BO > Design > Image Setttings and scroll down to image generation options * JPEG/PNG should be checked * The checkbox of AVIF should be enable * JPEG/PNG should be greyed * You can’t unchecked the JPEG/PNG format Check the Webp checkbox ( you should have 3 checkboxes checked ) You should have a message “Caution the selection of several image formats leads to a need for memory capacity greater and impact the perf during the generation”

item.title: BO - Design - Image Settings - Image Generation options - Automated version
item.description: BO - Design - Image Settings - Image Generation options - Automated version Steps Step Description Expected result Case : Your server doesn’t support Avif * Go to BO > Design > Image Setttings and scroll down to image generation options * JPEG/PNG should be checked * The checkbox of AVIF should be disable * You’ll see an error message next to the Avif : “Your server does not support Avif formar, for more infomation visit this link”

item.title: BO - Design - Image Settings - Regenerate thumbnail
item.description: BO - Design - Image Settings - Regenerate thumbnail Steps Step Description Expected result * Go to BO > Design > Image Setttings and scroll down to image generation options * Check all the format you can do * Clic on the “Save” button * All the format should be checked * You should have a message “Caution the selection of several image formats leads to a need for memory capacity greater and impact the perf during the generation” * Scroll down to Regenerate thumbnails.

item.title: BO - Design - Image Settings - Image Generation on creation
item.description: BO - Design - Image Settings - Image Generation on creation Steps Step Description Expected result * Go to BO > Design > Image Setttings and scroll down to image generation options * Check WebP format * JPEG/PNG should be checked * JPEG/PNG should be greyed * You can’t unchecked the JPEG/PNG format * Webp should be checked * Go to catalog > Product

BO - Design - Image Settings - Check category image format
item.description: BO - Design - Image Settings - Check category image format Steps Step Description Expected result * Go to BO > Design > Image settings * Scroll down to have image generation option * JPEG/PNG should be checked * You can’t unchecked the JPEG/PNG format * Base format should be : “Use PNG only if the base image is in PNG format” Check the checkboxes next to Webp The checkbox should be checked and the Webp is enabled * Go to Catalog > categories * Clic on “Add new category” * You should have all your categories * You have the page to create a category * Set a category with a name and three image in PNG * Clic on “Save” * You should have the name on the category name and the url of image on image selection * You have a green modal and it say : “Successful update” * Go to Catalog > categories * Clic on “Add new category” * You should have all your categories * You have the page to create a category * Set a category with a name and three image in JPEG * Clic on “Save” * You should have the name on the category name and the url of image on image selection * You have a green modal and it say : “Successful update” * Go to Catalog > categories * Clic on “Add new category” * You should have all your categories * You have the page to create a category * Set a category with a name and three image in WebP * Clic on “Save” * You should have the name on the category name and the url of image on image selection * You have a green modal and it say : “Successful update” Go to your folder [yourshop]/img/c There is no image on Webp Drag and drop [idofyour category PNG]_category_default.

item.title: BO - Design - Image Settings - Check stores image format
item.description: BO - Design - Image Settings - Check stores image format Steps Step Description Expected result * Go to BO > Design > Image settings * Scroll down to have image generation option * JPEG/PNG should be checked * You can’t unchecked the JPEG/PNG format * Base format should be : “Use PNG only if the base image is in PNG format” Check the checkboxes next to Webp The checkbox should be checked and the Webp is enabled * Go to Shop Parameters > Contact > Stores
